hero.title: Who We Are
hero.subtitle: A student-led movement to make AI education accessible, impactful, and responsible.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.quote: We help high schoolers learn and apply AI and data science to solve local problems—responsibly.
mission.content:
Atlanta AI & Data Lab was founded in 2023 by three high school juniors frustrated by the lack of hands-on tech opportunities in their schools. They wanted more than lectures—they wanted to build things that mattered.

Today, we're a nonprofit serving 147+ students across metro Atlanta, partnering with community organizations to turn classroom learning into real-world impact.

values.title: Accessible
values.description: No barriers—free programs, loaned equipment, beginner-friendly.

values.title: Applied
values.description: Learning by doing; projects with purpose.

values.title: Accountable
values.description: Ethics aren't an afterthought—they're embedded in every project.

officers.name: Maya S.
officers.bio: I joined because I wanted to see if I could actually code. Turns out, I can - and I love teaching others how.
officers.focus: Applied AI Track Lead | Built Community Food Access Map

officers.name: Jordan T.
officers.bio: Good design means everyone can use it. I'm here to make sure we build for real people, not just tech bros.
officers.focus: UX & Accessibility Lead | Designed School Attendance Dashboard

officers.name: Alex P.
officers.bio: Numbers tell stories. I want to make sure we're telling the right ones - and listening to who's left out.
officers.focus: Civic Data Track Lead | Led Youth Employment Survey Analysis

officers.name: Priya N.
officers.bio: If we're not asking 'who could this harm?' we're not doing our jobs.
officers.focus: AI Literacy Facilitator | Leads bias audits for all projects

hero.title: Measuring What Matters
hero.subtitle: We hold ourselves accountable. Here's how we track access, learning, and long-term pathways—and what we've achieved so far.

hero.title: Programs That Meet You Where You Are
hero.subtitle: Three pathways designed for beginners, builders, and future AI leaders. No prior experience required.

programs.title: AI Literacy
programs.summary: Short, interactive activities that demystify AI. Learn how algorithms make decisions, practice spotting bias, and discuss real-world implications.
details: Hands-on exercises with visual AI tools (no coding required to start)
Guest speakers from tech, policy, and advocacy
programs.bestFor: Students new to AI; curious about tech's role in society
programs.outcomes: Earn a digital badge; present one ethics case study

programs.title: Applied AI for Community
programs.summary: Hands-on project teams tackling real needs identified by local partners. Learn Python, data analysis, and deployment—while building something that matters.
details: Partner with nonprofits, schools, or city departments
Build prototypes: maps, dashboards, recommendation tools
programs.bestFor: Students ready to code (or eager to learn fast)
programs.outcomes: Portfolio project; technical mentorship; college/internship references

programs.title: Data Science for Civic Impact
programs.summary: Turn messy data into clear insights that drive community decisions. Learn surveys, data cleaning, visualization, and storytelling.
details: Design surveys and collect data (with proper consent)
Clean and analyze datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, Python)
Write policy briefs and present to partners
programs.bestFor: Students interested in research, journalism, policy, or public health
programs.outcomes: Published report; presentation to community board; data portfolio

faqs.question: Do I need coding experience?
faqs.answer: No! AI Literacy requires zero coding. Applied AI and Data Science assume you're willing to learn - we provide resources and pair you with mentors.

faqs.question: Can I do more than one program?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Many students start with AI Literacy, then move to a project track. You can also repeat programs with new projects.

faqs.question: How do you pick project topics?
faqs.answer: We partner with local nonprofits and city agencies to identify real needs. Students vote on which projects to tackle each cycle.

faqs.question: What if I miss sessions?
faqs.answer: Life happens. Let your team lead know. We record workshops and provide async resources. Consistent communication is key.

hero.title: High schoolers learning AI—building for good.
hero.subtitle: We teach data science and responsible AI through hands-on projects that solve real community problems.
